original: BERGLUND, Edward Salomon, Bergsingenjör, Djursholm, f Gävle 8/6 71 av lokför J B o Brita Maria Sundgren, gm (1) Ingeborg Holm, d 25, (2) Tyra Söderman. Falu bergs-sk 90—91, KTH o bergsh.sk 97—00. Kem v Falu kopparv 91—97, gruvmät v Grängesb gemens förvaltn 00—03, gruvförv o gruving v AB Ryllshytte zink- o blygruv o v Garpenbergs AB gruv 03—10, gruvförv o öv.ing v AB Garpenb zink- o koppargruv 05—11, disp o öv.ing v Trollh el.term. AB 11—18, förest f komm.koll gruvkartekont 18—37, 1. byråing 19—37, sekr i malmkomm 18—23, led. av 1917 års mineralkomm 20—23. Led. i fullmakt, nmdr o komm i Garpenb o Trollh. FI metallurg patent i Sv o utl. Resor: I de fi europ länd 05—39, USA, Mexiko o Västin 07, Marocko o Madeira 33. Av trycket: Om rostn.-försök m järnmalm, Om zink o dess fram-ställn 22, Några drag ur metall, äldre hist 23, Malmtillg i Norrb län (i Malmkomm. slutbe-tänk) 24, Om andra metaller än järn (i Uppfinn bok) 28, Om malmens försäljn, pris o värde 31, En ny sv bergslag (i Sv hdlsbks Index) 32, Vattenföror. gm avloppsvatten (i Medd fr Jernkont gruvbyrå) 38, medarb i Nord fam.bok 22—34. RVO.
translated: BERGLUND, Edward Salomon, Mining Engineer, Djursholm, b. Gävle 8/6 1871, son of locomotive engineer J B and Brita Maria Sundgren, m. (1) Ingeborg Holm, died in 1925, (2) Tyra Söderman. Attended Falun Mining School 1890-1891, Royal Institute of Technology and Bergsskolan 1897-1900. Worked in chemistry at Falun Copper Works 1891-1897, surveying at Grängesberg Joint Administration 1900-1903, mine management and mining at AB Ryllshytte zinc and lead mine and at Garpenbergs AB mine 1903-1910, mine management and chief engineer at AB Garpenb zinc and copper mine 1905-1911, dispatcher and chief engineer at Trollhättan Electric Power Company 1911-1918, superintendent of communal mining cartography office 1918-1937, first secretary 1919-1937, secretary of ore commission 1918-1923, member of the 1917 Mineral Commission 1920-1923. Authorized representative, committee member and commissioner in Garpenberg and Trollhättan. Received metallurgical patents in Sweden and abroad. Travelled extensively in several European countries from 1905 to 1939, visited the USA, Mexico and the West Indies in 1907, Morocco and Madeira in 1933. Publications include "Experiments on Rusting with Iron Ore," "Zinc and its Production" in 1922, "Some Aspects of Metal, Ancient History" in 1923, "Iron Ore Production in Norrbotten County" (conclusion of Mineral Commission report) in 1924, "Other Metals besides Iron" in Inventor's Book in 1928, "The Sale, Price, and Value of Ore" in 1931, "A New Swedish Mining District" in Swedish Commercial Yearbooks Index in 1932, "Water Pollution caused by Sewage" in Communications from Jernkontoret Mining Bureau in 1938, contributor to "Nordisk Familjebok" from 1922 to 1934. Recipient of the Royal Order of Vasa.
